page.title: 09CHANGES IN EARITH
page.content:
Over the last{60 years}there have been many{changes.}Before{sanitation,} sewage was collected by cart,and before that, people dug a hole in the yard. There used to be a{tan yard}for horses, owned by{The Guest House,} which is now called{The Riverview Inn. Today there are only{2 pubs}but there used to be about{9.}There were also 2{ {blacksmiths,}a{wheel wright,}a{milking {parlour}and a{jam factory}in Earith. The{River Ouse}was used more for businesses, where as today it is used for leisure. The Seven Hole Bridge over the river has only 3 holes now! There used to be a railway station, but it no longer exists.
(By Trevor Smith and Robert Ellinor aged 11)
